Posts.Content: ninel wrote: Hi all, I am going in to get my bilateral mastectomy at the beginning of January (Happy New Year to me!!!!). I will have to undergo chest wall and lymphnode area radiation. Once that is over and done with I will be doing reconstruction. I was under the impression I can get implants, but my breast surgeon is saying chest wall radiation and implants don't really jive. He gave me a referral to 2 plastic surgeons. One that is well experienced with Tram flaps and the other is well experienced with implants. Is there anyone out there who had chest wall radiation and still got the implants? I know there is a chance of the capsular contracture, but its major surgery. More major then just implant placement. Thanks, Ninel Dx 6/27/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/13 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Chest Wall Radiation and Reconstruction ninel 55andstillalive

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2009 11:38AM - edited Jan 3, 2009 11:40AM by ninel Hi Pam, Where did you live in LOL? I live in Wilderness Lakes. Yes, I did go to Moffitt. Did you? Who was your oncologist? It turns out that 4 separate doctors recommended that I do not need radiation. I had neoadjuvant chemo and I had my bilat mastectomy with expanders on Dec 17th. They took out 12 nodes and the path report came back all clear. It seems that the chemo killed ALL the cancer. Ninel

Posts.Content: ninel wrote: I have always had headaches every once in a while, but now that I was given a clean bill of health every little pain I think the cancer has spread. At first I couldn't catch my breath and so I thought it spread to lungs. That went away. Then I had a pain in my knee, uh huh it spread to my bones. Now I am concentrating on my headaches. I started working again so I don't know if these headaches are stress related or weather related (I live in muggy , hot, humid florida) or am I just giving myself these headaches because I am constantly thinking and stressing about this. What kind of headaches do you get with brain metastisis? Are they sharp or dull? Are they constant on a daily basis or is it every once in a while? I read up on the symptoms and I don't have seizures or any other symptoms aside from headaches. Thanks, Ninel Dx 6/27/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/13 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
